intro: Draba alchemilloides, commonly known as alpine penny-cress, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to alpine and arctic regions of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in rocky and barren environments. The plant has basal leaves that are pinnately lobed and small, white or yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It is characterized by its ability to tolerate harsh climates and is often found in high-altitude meadows. Draba alchemilloides plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation to extreme conditions.
